decks.notes: The deck focuses on generating massive card advantage and mana with cards like Paradoxical Outcome, Tinker, and Time Vault combo. It aims to assemble a fast combo win condition, usually involving the powerful artifact, Blightsteel Colossus. The deck includes a control element with cards like Force of Will and Mental Misstep to protect its combo pieces and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The presence of Erayo, Soratami Ascendant also adds a stax element, further impeding the opponent's ability to stop the deck from executing its game plan. Overall, the deck aims for a quick and efficient win through its combo pieces and control elements.

The deck focuses on utilizing Mishra's Workshop to ramp out artifact creatures and disrupt opponent's mana base with cards like Wasteland and Sphere of Resistance. It aims to overwhelm the opponent with efficient artifact creatures like Arcbound Ravager and Walking Ballista, while also using cards like Phyrexian Revoker and Chalice of the Void to disrupt opponent's strategies. The deck's synergy with artifacts and ability to generate mana allows it to quickly establish board presence and apply pressure to the opponent in a Vintage 1 vs 1 setting.

This deck focuses on controlling the game through disruption and card advantage while utilizing the Oath of Druids card as a win condition. It includes counterspells like Force of Will and Flusterstorm to counter the opponent's threats, along with draw spells like Brainstorm and Dig Through Time to maintain card advantage. The deck also features powerful creatures like Inferno Titan, Griselbrand, and Jace, the Mind Sculptor for additional win conditions. Additionally, it includes a selection of powerful mana acceleration cards like Moxen and Sol Ring to quickly establish board presence.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize the dredge mechanic to quickly fill the graveyard with key creatures like Golgari Grave-Troll and Prized Amalgam. By using cards like Bazaar of Baghdad and Mana Confluence to discard cards and dredge, the deck aims to create a powerful board presence with cards like Bridge from Below and Dread Return. The deck also includes disruption with Cabal Therapy and Mental Misstep, as well as protection with Force of Will. The goal is to eventually bring back powerful creatures like Elesh Norn, Grand Cenobite and Ashen Rider for a game-winning combo.

This deck focuses on using powerful spells like Force of Will, Jace, the Mind Sculptor, and Snapcaster Mage to control the game and outvalue the opponent. It also utilizes efficient card draw and counterspells to protect its game plan. With access to powerful blue cards like Ancestral Recall and Time Walk, as well as versatile cards like Snapcaster Mage and Dack Fayden, this deck aims to control the game and disrupt the opponent's strategy while setting up its own win condition through card advantage and precise spell selection.

The deck focuses on generating card advantage and mana acceleration to set up a powerful combo finish with Paradoxical Outcome. By utilizing fast mana sources like Moxen and powerful draw spells like Ancestral Recall and Timetwister, the deck aims to cycle through its library, generate a large amount of mana, and cast multiple spells in a single turn to either storm off with Tendrils of Agony or generate a lethal Mind's Desire. The deck also includes disruption in the form of Force of Will and Defense Grid to protect its key combo pieces and disrupt the opponent's game plan.

The deck aims to quickly assemble the Time Vault and Voltaic Key combo through card draw, mana acceleration, and interaction. The goal is to generate a large amount of mana, draw into the combo pieces, and then take extra turns using Time Vault's ability to win the game. The deck also has backup win conditions like Blightsteel Colossus and Monastery Mentor. It utilizes Paradoxical Outcome as a key card to draw into crucial pieces and generate even more mana, while also being able to bounce key permanents for value.

This deck focuses on using fast, efficient spells to control the game while also putting pressure on the opponent with aggressive creatures like Delver of Secrets and Young Pyromancer. By disrupting the opponent's game plan with counterspells and removal, while also generating additional value through cards like Snapcaster Mage, the deck aims to end the game quickly before the opponent can stabilize. The inclusion of powerful card draw spells like Ancestral Recall and Dig Through Time allows the deck to maintain card advantage and keep the pressure on the opponent.

The deck focuses on using Oath of Druids as a control strategy, with the goal of quickly getting out powerful creatures like Griselbrand or Inferno Titan. It includes a mix of card draw, counterspells, and powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor to control the game and protect its own threats. The deck also includes a variety of fast mana accelerants like the Moxen and Library of Alexandria to help cast its spells quickly and efficiently. Additionally, it includes disruption like Sorcerous Spyglass and Pyroblast to disrupt the opponent's strategy.

The key concept of this deck is to quickly assemble a board presence of artifact creatures, using efficient mana accelerators like Mishra's Workshop and Ancient Tomb. The deck aims to disrupt opponents with disruptive artifacts like Sphere of Resistance and Chalice of the Void, while also leveraging synergy between cards such as Arcbound Ravager and Hangarback Walker to generate threats and close out the game quickly. The inclusion of cards like Walking Ballista and Steel Overseer provide additional ways to pump up the artifact creatures and overwhelm the opponent.

The deck focuses on quickly deploying threats and disrupting the opponent with disruptive artifacts like Chalice of the Void, Trinisphere, and Sphere of Resistance. It aims to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures like Walking Ballista, Steel Overseer, and Arcbound Ravager while utilizing mana acceleration from Moxen and Mishra's Workshop. The deck also has a mana denial strategy with cards like Wasteland and Strip Mine. It looks to control the board and maintain pressure with a mix of efficient threats and disruptive elements to secure victory.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with Dredge cards using Bazaar of Baghdad and other discard strategies. Once the graveyard is sufficiently filled, the deck aims to bring back powerful creatures like Golgari Grave-Troll and Bloodghast with Dread Return, creating a strong board presence that can overwhelm the opponent. The inclusion of disruptive cards like Cabal Therapy and Leyline of the Void helps to control the game and disrupt the opponent's strategy, allowing the deck to execute its combo efficiently.

The deck focuses on utilizing mana acceleration and disruptive artifacts to quickly overwhelm opponents with powerful creatures. By deploying threats such as Walking Ballista, Arcbound Ravager, and Hangarback Walker, supported by cards like Phyrexian Revoker and Sphere of Resistance, the deck aims to apply early pressure and disrupt opponents' game plans. With a strong mana base featuring Mishra's Workshop and Wasteland, the deck is capable of deploying multiple threats in the early game, making it a formidable Aggro-MUD archetype in Vintage 1 vs 1 format.

This deck focuses on playing low-cost spells and utilizing powerful mana acceleration to quickly cast threats that can overwhelm the opponent. It uses card draw and selection to find key cards, while also packing disruption in the form of counterspells and removal. The deck's main goal is to establish a strong board presence early in the game and maintain pressure on the opponent to close out the game quickly. The inclusion of powerful planeswalkers and creatures with evasion further solidify its aggressive strategy.

This deck aims to disrupt the opponent through various means such as countermagic and removal spells while also adding pressure with efficient threats. The deck utilizes synergy between cards like Deathrite Shaman and Leovold, Emissary of Trest to generate value and control the game. With a mix of card draw, versatile creatures, and powerful spells, the deck seeks to outpace and outmaneuver opponents in the midrange game, establishing board control and card advantage to close out the game quickly.

The deck focuses on quickly establishing a board presence with efficient artifact creatures such as Arcbound Ravager, Hangarback Walker, and Lodestone Golem. Utilizing powerful artifact lands like Mishra's Workshop and Wasteland, along with mana acceleration from artifacts like Black Lotus and the Mox series, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Phyrexian Revoker and Sphere of Resistance. By overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures and taxing effects, the deck looks to win through sheer power and efficiency in a fast-paced game.
